programme.title: Men's College Wrestling
programme.desc: From T-Mobile Center in Kansas City, Mo.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Kraken carry a four-game road win streak into their meeting with the Golden Knights. Vegas leads the series between the NHL's newest franchises 9-2-0. Jonathan Marchessault (VGK) boasts three goals in three contests against Seattle this season.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 2 Buckeyes engage the No. 15 Black Bears in the first round of the NCAA Tournament. Jacy Sheldon paces Ohio State with 18 points per game. Anne Simon, who leads Maine with 18.8 ppg, didn't come off the floor during an America East title run.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 1 Gamecocks (32-0) kick off their NCAA Tournament run in the first round against the No. 16 Blue Hose (21-14). South Carolina dismantled Presbyterian 99-29 on Dec. 16, 2023, the Gamecocks' second-most lopsided decision of the season.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 3 Tigers (28-5) begin their national championship defense by hosting the No. 14 Owls (19-14) in the first round of the NCAA Tournament. Rice makes a fourth trip to the dance after winning its first American Athletic Conference title.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. The primary host is Rece Davis, joined by analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis. The show typically originates from the site of one of the day's biggest games.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 6 Lady Volunteers (19-11) fly with the No. 11 Phoenix (27-6) in the NCAA Tournament first round. Eight-time national champion Tennessee last won the title in 2008. Green Bay wore the Horizon League crown for the first time since 2018.

programme.title: NCAA Women's Basketball Championship Studio
programme.desc: Hosts and analysts discuss the NCAA women's basketball tournament.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 2 Fighting Irish (26-6) host the No. 15 Golden Flashes (21-10) in the NCAA Tournament first round. Notre Dame has won eight straight, including the ACC title game. Kent State, the Mid-American Conference champion, last danced in 2002.

programme.title: NCAA Women's Basketball Championship Studio
programme.desc: Hosts and analysts discuss the NCAA women's basketball tournament.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 16 Islanders go dancing with the No. 1 Trojans in the NCAA Tournament's first round. Texas A&M-Corpus Christi captured its first Southland Conference title after 18 seasons. JuJu Watkins (USC) is second in the nation with 27 points per game.

programme.title: NCAA Women's Basketball Championship Studio
programme.desc: Hosts and analysts discuss the NCAA women's basketball tournament.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Arizona goes up against Auburn in this First Four match that determines a No. 11 seed for the NCAA Tournament. The Wildcats, the 2021 national runner-up, make a fourth straight tourney appearance. The winner draws No. 6 Syracuse in the round of 64.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The Crusaders fly with the Skyhawks in an NCAA Tournament First Four contest. Tennessee-Martin seeks its first round-of-64 appearance since making four straights trips from 2011-2014. Holy Cross put its name on back-to-back Patriot League banners.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Second free practice of round 3 of the 2024 Formula One World Championship, the Australia Grand Prix at Albert Park in Melbourne, Australia.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: When Khabib Nurmagomedov retired from MMA, the UFC's lightweight title was up for grabs. See the journey of the 155-pound belt following the Khabib Era, featuring Charles Oliveira, Dustin Poirier, Islam Makhachev, and more.

programme.title: World of X Games
programme.desc: Previews, highlights and stories involving events and athletes from the X Games.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: Compelling stories centered around sports and athletes, ranging from dramatic to comedic.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Kraken carry a four-game road win streak into their meeting with the Golden Knights. Vegas leads the series between the NHL's newest franchises 9-2-0. Jonathan Marchessault (VGK) boasts three goals in three contests against Seattle this season.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: NCAA Championship In the Studio
programme.desc: ESPN basketball analysts discuss upcoming NCAA Tournament games.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 8 Tar Heels face the No. 9 Spartans in the first round of the NCAA Tournament. Michigan State had a five-game win streak snapped in its Big Ten Tournament opener. North Carolina won the last meeting 62-53 in the 2014 NCAA second round.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 6 Cardinals and No. 11 Blue Raiders tip off in the first round of the NCAA Tournament. Middle Tennessee State has won 19 in a row after rolling through Liberty in the Conference USA title match. MTSU downed Louisville 67-49 on Dec. 4, 2022.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 13 Thundering Herd draw the No. 4 Hokies in the NCAA Tournament's first round. Marshall has won 20 of 21 to claim its first Sun Belt title and second NCAA berth, the Herd's first since 1997. Virginia Tech reached the Final Four last year.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 8 Crimson Tide (23-9) face the No. 9 Seminoles (23-10) in the NCAA Tournament's first round. Alabama dances for the third time in four seasons following a 21-year drought. Florida State qualified for an 11th consecutive March Madness.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 7 Cyclones face the No. 10 Terrapins in the NCAA Tournament's first round. Iowa State's bid for back-to-back Big 12 titles was foiled by Texas, while Maryland upset top-seeded Ohio State before falling in the Big Ten Tournament's semifinals.

programme.title: NCAA Championship In the Studio
programme.desc: ESPN basketball analysts discuss upcoming NCAA Tournament games.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 2 Cardinal (28-5) host the No. 15 Spartans (27-5) in the NCAA Tournament's first round. Stanford, the 2021 champion, is led by Pac-12 Player of the Year Cameron Brink. Norfolk State owns two straight Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference titles.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: A collection of matchups with palpable competitive heat, which came to a head inside the Octagon. Featuring Nate Diaz vs. Anthony Pettis, Daniel Cormier vs. Volkan Oezdemir, and Israel Adesanya vs. Paulo Costa.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Qualifying of round 3 of the 2024 Formula One World Championship, the Australia Grand Prix at Albert Park in Melbourne, Australia.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Three heavyweight brawls with "sudden ending" written all over them. Featuring Derrick Lewis vs. Alexander Volkov, Fabricio Werdum vs. Stipe Miocic, and Alistair Overeem vs. Curtis Blaydes.

programme.title: UFC 268: Usman vs. Covington 2
programme.desc: Kamaru Usman defended his title once again against heated rival and No. 1 ranked contender Colby Covington. From Madison Square Garden on Nov. 6, 2021.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Exclusive takes on the biggest news, stars, and stories from UFC.

programme.title: Talk That Talk: Seniesa vs. Valle
programme.desc: Pre-fight discussion from boxers Seniesa Estrada and Yokasta Valle, who will fight for the undisputed WBA and WBC minimumweight crowns on March 29.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston Outdoors
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston visits unique locations and shares his fishing knowledge.

programme.title: Scott Martin Challenge
programme.desc: Scott Martin and Justin Atkins go head-to-head in Alabama for an SMC Record Breaking Catch.

programme.title: National High School Dance Championship: Hip Hop
programme.desc: High school dance teams compete for the hip hop national title.

programme.title: National High School Dance Championship: Jazz
programme.desc: The best high school jazz dance teams compete for the national title. From Orlando, Fla.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: ESPN's morning sports magazine show, featuring the biggest names and stories in sports.

programme.title: 2024 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 1 Pirates (21-12) draw the Mean Green (19-14) in the second round of the 2024 NIT. Seton Hall required overtime to oust Saint Joseph's in its opener, with Al-Amir Dawes going off for a 26-point double-double. North Texas knocked off LSU.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 13 Stags (31-1) draw the No. 4 Hoosiers (24-5) in the first round of the NCAA Tournament. Fairfield rolled through the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference en route to a second title in three years. Indiana beat Fairfield 91-58 on Dec. 9, 2021.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 6 Orange (23-7) and No. 11 Wildcats (18-15) meet in the first round of the NCAA Tournament. Arizona got past Auburn in the First Four to secure its spot in the round of 64. Arizona won the only previous meeting with Syracuse, 80-74 in 2011.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The Ivy League champion No. 9 Tigers (25-4) challenge the No. 8 Mountaineers (24-7) in the NCAA Tournament's round of 64. Princeton has won 20 of its last 21 outings. West Virginia defeated Princeton 74-65 in the first round of the 2016 tourney.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 4 Bulldogs face the No. 13 Anteaters in the NCAA Tournament's first round. UC Irvine claimed its first Big West crown since 1995. Gonzaga's 24-game win streak was snapped with a one-point loss to Portland in the West Coast Conference final.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 15 Lancers (28-3) tilt with the No. 2 Bruins (25-6) in the first round of the NCAA Tournament. California Baptist is dancing for the first time after capturing the Western Athletic Conference title in its sixth campaign in Division I.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Formula One drivers take to the streets of Melbourne for the Australian Grand Prix. Last year, Max Verstappen earned his first victory down under, with Lewis Hamilton and Fernando Alonso rounding out the podium. Verstappen has won both races in 2024.

programme.title: UFC Main Events
programme.desc: UFC women's strawweight champion Zhang Weili and former champion Joanna Jedrzejczyk battled it out in a bout that will go down as one of the greatest fights in UFC history. From March 7, 2020.

programme.title: UFC Main Events
programme.desc: UFC lightweight champion Khabib Nurmagomedov remained undefeated following a hard-fought victory against interim UFC lightweight champion, Dustin Poirier. From UFC 242 on Sept. 7, 2019.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Formula One drivers take to the streets of Melbourne for the Australian Grand Prix. Last year, Max Verstappen earned his first victory down under, with Lewis Hamilton and Fernando Alonso rounding out the podium. Verstappen has won both races in 2024.

programme.title: APP Tour Pickleball
programme.desc: From Miami Beach Convention Center in Miami Beach, Fla.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: From Katie Seashole Pressly Stadium in Gainesville, Fla.

programme.title: 2024 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The Golden Gophers continue their Hoosier State tour by visiting the No. 1 Sycamores in the NIT second round. Minnesota ousted Butler 73-72 in its opener behind two late free throws and 15 assists by Elijah Hawkins. Indiana State bounced SMU 101-92.

programme.title: 2024 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 1 Demon Deacons try to exact revenge from the No. 4 Bulldogs in an NIT second-round affair. Georgia beat Wake Forest 80-77 in each side's second game this season. Wake ousted Appalachian State in the first round while Georgia got by Xavier.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Shirley
programme.desc: Shirley is the real story of the inimitable Shirley Muldowney. Salty, sassy, unflappable - Shirley crushed stereotypes and became an integral part of the gritty, golden age of drag racing. Her aggressive approach fueled intense rivalries, passionate fan reactions, and sometimes caustic headlines but never derailed her quest to be a champion.

programme.desc: The Bulls host the Celtics. On this day in 1982, Boston's Larry Bird posted 25 points and 14 rebounds from off the bench in a 110-103 win at Chicago. In 1998, Hall of Famer Scottie Pippen torched Boston for 27 points in a 111-88 verdict for Chicago.
